website_summaries.verdict: Feedback for the Salomon Sense Ride 2 was positive. People were generally happy with what this product had to offer. The longevity of its materials and its capacity to remain agreeable after many miles became the highlights of consumers’ experiences. The accommodating forefoot design and the reactive midsole were also hailed. On the other hand, a couple was unhappy with the initially irritating inner wall of the upper unit.The Salomon Sense Ride 2 is designed for neutral pronators who enjoy adventuring on the trails. It is also made to welcome novice and expert runners alike.
pros: People who have tested the Salomon Sense Ride 2 felt that it remained comfortable, even after miles of running
The grip capacity was considered by many to be versatile enough to handle for hard and soft ground
The cushioning system was appreciated for being full-bodied and long-lasting
Most consumers stated that the width profile followed their usual expectations
The toe box was spacious enough to accommodate the natural splaying capacity of the toes, several runners commented
cons: A couple of testers reported that the inner sleeve rubbed uncomfortably against the skin during the initial runs

customer_reviews.title: A very comfortable and good looking Salamon shoe.
customer_reviews.text: I've had three pairs of speedcross 4 and loved them however the toe box was very snug ...the sense ride 2 fits more comfortably than the speed cross due to the larger toe box and softer material. I just recieved and wore them for a couple hours. I'll report how they held up later.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: Really like these shoes. They look great and are sooo comfortable. They are great on trails with great traction and support but are so comfortable I find myself using them as everyday shoes. Highly recommend; in fact, I bought myself a second pair.
customer_reviews.author: rcc

customer_reviews.title: My New Daily Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I use the Speed Cross Salomon for trail runs and other workouts but i liked the Salomon brand and wanted to find a shoe to work for nail use and i choose this shoe. They are crazy comfortable, light and durable and will handle the rough stuff i will put it through. I am tired of UA and I am looking to get into a new shoe company and for me that is gonna be Salomon.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great trail shoe that looks good in casual environments as well
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for our trip through western Europe which including a lot of walking in cities sight seeing as well as some pretty legit hikes through the Swiss Alps, these shoes did great in both areas. Traction was great walking on slick rocks by waterfalls, never had any foot issues walking 10 plus miles a day, also the shoes didn't look bad with normal clothes on in an urban and social environment.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Thornton

customer_reviews.title: Salomon is pretty dependable
customer_reviews.text: Very comfy shoe for road and trail. You really can’t beat the pacing system. Initially were squeaky but after a couple days they quieted.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use Lace and best sole for trail running
customer_reviews.text: One of the best I ever had. I use this shoe for trail running, playing cricket and treks. Comfortable and breathable.
customer_reviews.author: Khushi M

customer_reviews.title: NOT a trail running shoe
customer_reviews.text: Pros: VERY light weight and breathable for a nice summer WALKING shoe. Cons: Could not be a worse trail shoe, any torque or twisting and the whole sole with fold under and feel like it is coming off! Running on well maintained fire roads, flat easy trails ok...ANYTHING with rocks, roots, mud...forget it - they feel like slippers in anything near rough.
customer_reviews.author: Michael F. Houff

customer_reviews.title: Excellent transition trail shoe
customer_reviews.text: Excellent all round running shoe, needs something transitional between light trails and pavement running and this fits the bill perfectly. Cushions and holds your foot very nicely, and the quick lace is a system. I will say I’ve discovered I have to crank the laces down tighter than you’d think when i start a run but it keeps the shoes nice and secure. Overall definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Tongue of shoe was too long.
customer_reviews.text: The feel of the running shoe was fine, but the shoe tongue extended out too far for my liking. I could tell there would be some issues with chafing on front of my ankle when running. I guess if you were wearing long socks that extended up your leg, the problem would be minimal but I wear socks that stop at the bottom of my ankle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stylish
customer_reviews.text: These are my third pair of Salomon's and they are my favorite thus far. They look and feel great; everywhere I go I get compliments about them.
customer_reviews.author: Ed L.

customer_reviews.title: Nice fit,  nice shoe
customer_reviews.text: These seem more comfortable and wider than the Speedcross 4 I usually wear.
customer_reviews.author: almeyse

customer_reviews.title: Porous
customer_reviews.text: Walk through wet grass and socks will get quite wet. Have to be selective with trails with these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: lotsofpotluck

customer_reviews.title: Not that great looking of a shoe
customer_reviews.text: These are just ok. The color and design remind you of old school Addis shoes. Not that cool to be honest.
customer_reviews.author: Jon P.

customer_reviews.title: Totally worth your money
customer_reviews.text: Hubby says the shoes are comfy for running and lifting. Fits perfectly. Worth your money
customer_reviews.author: Lilly

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality-One Flaw
customer_reviews.text: I loved the look and feel of the shoe, i had serious issues with the string pull laces and the large amount of extra slack that couldn't be tucked properly.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair of Salomon trail running shoes and I love them. There is a lot of room in the toe box, which has always been a problem for me with other shoes. For a bulkier trail shoe, they also feel very light and breathe well.
customer_reviews.author: Will Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Siza is as expected
customer_reviews.text: Size was perfect, comfortable and reliable. I use it for running and for hiking as well and it is the right tool for the job.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo Torres

customer_reviews.title: Narrow fit, firm cushion
customer_reviews.text: Not for me. Narrow fit for wider feet. not comfortable for standing long periods. Does breathe well, and quality Salomon construction.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk

customer_reviews.title: Amazing shoes. Exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: I like to go running in the trails in San Diego and these shoes are very comfortable and has a very good grip.
customer_reviews.author: Walid

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, yes. Durable, no.
customer_reviews.text: I like the shoe. Really good support but I've had the shoe for almost two months and the sole is already beginning to come apart and rub through. Really disappointed in that.
customer_reviews.author: Robert G. Stephenson Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoe
customer_reviews.text: Bought these because I heard good things from a few friends, and let me just say I run through wooded trails and neighborhood sidewalks and these shoes do great on both.
customer_reviews.author: Freddy Garza

customer_reviews.title: Extremely comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: Wear for 12 hour hospital shifts. Extremely comfortable and worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what you’d expect from a good shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for trail running. It’s my favorite pair of shoes. I even use these when I go hiking and do wildlife photography. My next pair will be Salomons.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob W.

customer_reviews.title: Buy them!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing in every way. Great for trail, gym or road. Buy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Salmon Running Shoes
customer_reviews.text: Good shoe fits great very comfortable and I love the shoe laces
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe. Took off running and no issues. Fit is true and very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can’t tie shoelaces!!!
customer_reviews.text: The shoelaces were the killer! Not conventional!. That’s the only reason I returned the shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Eubank

customer_reviews.title: Very stylish
customer_reviews.text: Very light, cool, comfy also get compliments on my shoes .
customer_reviews.author: william

customer_reviews.title: great shoes for running, hiking and everyday wear
customer_reviews.text: great shoes, only con would be that the outsole is squeaky sometimes when it gets a little wet, not usually a problem though.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Burmeister

customer_reviews.title: A Successful Update
customer_reviews.text: As these are my return to Salomon I figured I’d add my input. Disclaimer: I purchased mine at local running store Fit for my E width feet was (too) snug in my typical US12 feet. The IS12.5 (EURO47.333) fits adequately. Tremendous underfoot feel off pavement. My only run in them to date hasn’t truly tested the traction but they hooked up fine in damp hero dirt. The Speedlace system is the one that’s finally got dialed in. Kudos Salomon.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

product_meta.title: SALOMON Men's Trail Running Shoe
product_meta.description: Maximize comfort on the trails with SENSE RIDE 2. With enough cushioning to push the mileage, an 8mm heel drop and proven fit, and an even more flexible, comfortable upper, you'll be ready to go all-day, every day.
feature_bullets: Comfort : A proven fit, improved with more flexion in the toe area, combines just the right amount of foothold with ample mobility for all-day comfort.
Grip : With an all-surface rubber compound and a versatile lug pattern, SENSE RIDE 2 ensures confident grip on both wet and dry surfaces.
Flexibility : Utilizing expertise from both trail and road running, the upper of SENSE RIDE 2 is precise but flexible, so you can run in complete comfort.
